body:
Exciting.
I really hope printing on Windows will work (#865).

I encountered a strange problem that program cannot start on Windows, after debugging I found that it was caused by `LoadLibrary("iphlpapi.dll")` failed with `ERROR_MOD_NOT_FOUND`, this is strange since `iphlpapi.dll` is a system library that guaranteed to exist, and previous version with Chrome38 runs the same code successfully on the same machine.

I think it should be some compilation settings of Chromium changed that made this fail, @paulcbetts do you know if any compilation configuration can make `LoadLibrary("iphlpapi.dll")` fail?

I'm looking into it now, but my psychic debugger is saying that Chrome 39 perhaps switched to amd64 and we're somehow loading the x86 version of the DLL (when you try to LoadLibrary a DLL of the wrong arch, you confusingly get a "Not found" error)

I'm trying to test this theory, but I'm getting a 403:

```
gyp http 403 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.20.0/node.lib
```
You need to comment out `update_atom_modules('spec')` in `bootstrap.py`, this happens when bootstrapping a new major release which hasn't been uploaded yet.

Hm, running under AppVerifier, I get a different crash:

```
(1828.2178): Access violation - code c0000005 (first chance)
First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.
This exception may be expected and handled.

WARNING: Stack unwind information not available. Following frames may be wrong.
00 011efa84 0098d0d8 chromiumcontent!v8::FunctionTemplate::GetFunction+0x4c
01 011efbc4 00969ea7 atom!atom::NodeBindings::CreateEnvironment+0x568 [c:\users\paul\appdata\local\temp\slack-build\atom-shell\atom\common\node_bindings.cc @ 246]
02 011efbf0 558a7c1c atom!atom::AtomBrowserMainParts::PostEarlyInitialization+0x107 [c:\users\paul\appdata\local\temp\slack-build\atom-shell\atom\browser\atom_browser_main_parts.cc @ 67]
03 011efc94 55a75585 chromiumcontent!content::BrowserMainLoop::EarlyInitialization+0x22c
04 011efcfc 55a6e7b0 chromiumcontent!content::BrowserMainRunner::Create+0x2e5
05 011efd40 5579d89a chromiumcontent!content::BrowserMain+0xd0
06 011efd60 5579d71b chromiumcontent!base::SharedMemory::Map+0x152a
07 011efdd0 5579f37d chromiumcontent!base::SharedMemory::Map+0x13ab
08 011efdf4 00959d03 chromiumcontent!content::ContentMain+0x4d
09 011efea8 00c44ca2 atom!wWinMain+0x2f3 [c:\users\paul\appdata\local\temp\slack-build\atom-shell\atom\app\atom_main.cc @ 109]
0a 011efef4 75732764 atom!__tmainCRTStartup+0x12f [f:\dd\vctools\crt\crtw32\dllstuff\crtexe.c @ 618]
0b 011eff08 77a0dc7a kernel32!BaseThreadInitThunk+0x24
0c 011eff50 77a0dc45 ntdll!__RtlUserThreadStart+0x2f
0d 011eff60 00000000 ntdll!_RtlUserThreadStart+0x1b
```

Hm, so by using gflags to enable loader snaps:

![](http://cl.ly/image/2t3Z41290b0J/content#png)

I see us not trying to load `iphlpapi.dll`, but calling LoadLibrary on a corrupt string:

```
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrLoadDll - ENTER: DLL name: ??????
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpLoadDllInternal - ENTER: DLL name: ??????.DLL
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpFindKnownDll - ENTER: DLL name: ??????.DLL
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpFindKnownDll - RETURN: Status: 0xc0000135
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpSearchPath - ENTER: DLL name: ??????.DLL
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpComputeLazyDllPath - INFO: DLL search path computed: C:\Users\Paul\AppData\Local\Temp\slack-build\atom-shell\out\Release;C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\;C:\WINDOWS\system;C:\WINDOWS;.;C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\Debuggers\x86\winext\arcade;C:\Program Files (x86)\Parallels\Parallels Tools\Applications;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\;C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\Windows Performance Toolkit\;C:\Program 
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpResolveDllName - ENTER: DLL name: C:\Users\Paul\AppData\Local\Temp\slack-build\atom-shell\out\Release\??????.DLL
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpResolveDllName - RETURN: Status: 0xc0000135
1d8c:1750 @ 80050296 - LdrpResolveDllName - ENTER: DLL name: C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\??????.DLL
```

Ah, found the bug:

``` c
static int ares_win32_init(void)
{
#ifdef USE_WINSOCK

  hnd_iphlpapi = 0;
  hnd_iphlpapi = LoadLibrary("iphlpapi.dll");   // Should be L"iphlpapi.dll" or LoadLibraryA
```

```
atom!ares_win32_init:
00b76c60 68d4d7e900      push    offset atom!`string' (00e9d7d4)
0:000> du 00e9d7d4         <--- Maybe it's Unicode?
00e9d7d4  "灩汨慰楰搮汬"
0:000> da 00e9d7d4         <--- Nope, it's ASCII
00e9d7d4  "iphlpapi.dll"

0:000> kn
 # ChildEBP RetAddr  
00 011ee524 00b76c75 KERNEL32!LoadLibraryWStub+0x2    <-- calling LoadLibraryW
01 011ee52c 00b76bfe atom!ares_win32_init+0x15 [c:\users\paul\appdata\local\temp\slack-build\atom-shell\vendor\node\deps\cares\src\ares_library_init.c @ 48]
```
Fixing that bug makes us able to start, rad:

@paulcbetts Thanks for debugging this, the whole progress is excellent!

I'll patch this in our node fork and report it to upstream.
